briefdescription.para: Ensure there is a console window to print to and read from.

detaileddescription.para: The console window is used to print to using touchgfx_printf(), printf() or std::cout, and read from using e.g. fgets() or std::cin. Alternatively, instead of using printf(), simply use touchgfx_printf() which will ensure there is a console to write to. After the first call to touchgfx_printf(), it will also be possible to read from stdin.

simplesect.para: This function is called automatically from HALSDL2::sdl_init(). It is therefore no longer necessary to call this function from user code.

briefdescription.para: TouchGFX printf that will only work on simulators.

detaileddescription.para: On Windows systems, a new console window will be created where the output is printed. On Linux systems, output will be sent to /var/log/syslog. For target systems, calls to touchgfx_printf() will be removed and will not cause any use of memory. Unlike printf(), touchfgx_printf() does not return number of characters written.

parameterdescription.para: Describes the format to use, see printf().
